intro: Gravesia stipulata, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gravesia stipulata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
